citation.article-title: Aerococcus urinaehominis sp. nov., isolated from human urine.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aerococcus urinaehominis sp. nov.
Aerococcus urinaehominis (u.ri'nae.ho'mi.nis. L. fem. n. urina urine; L. gen. n. hominis of man; M. L. gen. n. urinaehominis pertaining to human urine from which the bacterium was first isolated)
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming cocci occurring as single cells, in pairs, tetrads or in small groups.
It is facultatively anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-negative.
When grown on Columbia horse blood agar for 24 h at 37 °C colonies are small (<1 mm diameter), entire, non-pigmented and α-haemolytic.

Using commercial API systems acid is produced from glucose, maltose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, D-ribose and sucrose but not from D-arabitol, L-arabinose, cyclodextrin, glycogen, lactose, pullulan, sorbitol, tagatose, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, D-raffinose, tagatose, trehalose or D-xylose.
Positive reactions are observed for acid phosphatase, esterase C-4 (weak reaction), β-glucuronidase and pyrazinamidase.

Negative reactions are observed for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, arginine dihydrolase, chymotrypsin, cysteine arylamidase, ester lipase C8, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, glycine tryptophan arylamidase, lipase C14, leucine arylamidase, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, phosphoaminidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, trypsin, urease and valine arylamidase.
Alkaline phosphatase and β-glucosidase may or may not be produced.
Aesculin and hippurate are hydrolysed but gelatin is not.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite and acetoin is not produced.
